context: The Estonian verb 'söö' is the basic form of the verb meaning 'to eat'. It's used in various forms depending on the subject and tense: söön (I eat), sööd (you eat, informal singular), sööb (he/she/it eats), sööme (we eat), sööte (you all eat), söövad (they eat). The verb is commonly used daily when talking about meals and food consumption.
